alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 2:48AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Snow Developing this Afternoon... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Light to moderate snow. Accumulations of 1 to 2 inches will occur, but snowfall rates will be somewhat high. Accumulations of 2 to 4 inches will occur on Casper Mountain. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph with the snow. * WHERE...Natrona County, including Casper Mountain, and southern Johnson County. * WHEN...12 PM to 8 PM Today. * IMPACTS...Travelers should watch for slick and snow covered roads as well as rapid changes in visibility from snow and areas of blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...West to southwest winds, with gusts up to 40 mph, will impact the Casper area this afternoon, ahead of the cold front. These winds will be in place as snow reaches Casper late this afternoon.

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County
